meanings.definition: A person or thing that decomposes organic material.
meanings.sent1: The decomposer helped turn the old food into soil.
meanings.sent2: The decomposer in the compost bin broke down the banana peel.
meanings.sent3: The decomposer was so efficient, it turned the leftovers into rich soil in no time.
meanings.sent4: The decomposer worked tirelessly, transforming waste into valuable nutrients.
meanings.sent5: The decomposer's work was like magic, turning garbage into gold.

meanings.definition: An organism that breaks down dead plants and animals into simpler substances.
meanings.sent1: The decomposer in the forest helped recycle fallen leaves.
meanings.sent2: The decomposer, like a tiny recycling factory, turned the fallen tree into nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The decomposer had a never-ending buffet of fallen leaves to feast on.
meanings.sent4: The decomposer's role was like that of a nature's recycling crew.
meanings.sent5: The decomposer's job was to transform the deceased back into the building blocks of life.
